name: First Doctor
description: The first incarnation of the Doctor.

name: Second Doctor
description: The second incarnation of the Doctor.

name: Third Doctor
description: The third incarnation of the Doctor.

name: Fourth Doctor
description: The fourth incarnation of the Doctor.

name: Fifth Doctor
description: The fifth incarnation of the Doctor.

name: Sixth Doctor
description: The sixth incarnation of the Doctor.

name: Seventh Doctor
description: The seventh incarnation of the Doctor.

name: Eighth Doctor
description: The eighth incarnation of the Doctor.

name: War Doctor
description: The ninth incarnation of the Doctor.

name: Ninth Doctor
description: The tenth incarnation of the Doctor.

name: Tenth Doctor
description: The eleventh incarnation of the Doctor.

name: Eleventh Doctor
description: The twelfth incarnation of the Doctor.

name: Twelfth Doctor
description: The thirteenth incarnation of the Doctor.

name: Thirteenth Doctor
description: The fourteenth incarnation of the Doctor.

name: Fourteenth Doctor
description: The fifteenth incarnation of the Doctor.

name: Fifteenth Doctor
description: The sixteenth incarnation of the Doctor.

name: Rose Tyler
description: Rose Marion Tyler, knighted Dame Rose of the Powell Estate, was a companion of the Ninth and Tenth Doctors.

name: Micky Smith
description: Mickey Smith was a vehicle technician and resident of the Powell Estate who came to befriend the Doctor, Sarah Jane Smith, Captain Jack Harkness, Jackie Tyler and another world's Peter Tyler by virtue of his youthful romantic relationship with Rose Tyler.

name: Captain Jack Harkness
description: Captain Jack Harkness was the alias adopted by Time Agent and con man Javic Piotr Thane from the 51st century. He was a companion of the Ninth Doctor, and an associate of the Sixth, Tenth and Thirteenth Doctors.

name: Donna Noble
description: Donna Temple-Noble was a companion of the Tenth Doctor.

name: Martha Jones
description: Dr Martha Smith-Jones was a British physician and a companion of the Tenth Doctor.

name: Amy Pond
description: Amelia Jessica Pond — sometimes styled Amelia Williams after her marriage and also known as Amy — was a companion of the Eleventh Doctor.

name: Rory Williams
description: Rory Arthur Williams was a human nurse, husband of Amy Pond and companion of the Eleventh Doctor.

name: Clara Oswald
description: Clara Oswald was a companion of the Eleventh and Twelfth Doctors. On several occasions, while the Doctor was absent or incapacitated, she assumed the mantle, promise and name of "the Doctor", with the Twelfth Doctor acknowledging on one of these occasions that she "made a mighty fine Doctor".

name: Bill Potts
description: Bill Potts was the final companion of the Twelfth Doctor.

name: Graham O'Brien
description: Graham O'Brien was a companion of the Thirteenth Doctor. He lived in Sheffield with his wife Grace and her grandson Ryan Sinclair.

name: Ryan Sinclair
description: Ryan Sinclair was a companion of the Thirteenth Doctor. He worked as a warehouse worker, earning money while studying for his NVQ so that he could become a mechanic.

name: Yasmin Khan
description: Yasmin Khan, also known as Yaz, was a companion of the Thirteenth Doctor and a junior police officer with Hallamshire Police.

name: Dan Lewis
description: Daniel Lewis, or Dan for short, was a companion of the Thirteenth Doctor.

name: River Song
description: Melody Pond's third incarnation, best known as Professor River Song, was a "child of the TARDIS" and the wife of the Doctor, specifically of their eleventh and twelfth incarnations. She was mostly human, with some Time Lord DNA, and was conceived by her parents, Amy Pond and Rory Williams, aboard the TARDIS as it travelled through the Time Vortex. She was then raised and conditioned by the Silence, who used her unique DNA to transform her into the first of several Proto-Time Lords, granting her great strength, a deep understanding of the complex principles of time and space, and the ability to regenerate. She loved the Doctor dearly, and shared a long-lasting relationship with them. River was one of the very few people who knew the Doctor's true name.

name: Madame Vastra
description: Madame Vastra, born Va'stra and formally Vastra of the Eastern Lands was a Silurian detective who shared a house at 13 Paternoster Row with Jenny Flint, her maid and eventual wife, in Victorian London. Alongside Jenny and the Sontaran nurse Strax, Vastra investigated unusual activities. Vastra employed Strax as a butler in London while Jenny became the maid to cover any possible gossip.

name: Jenny Flint
description: Jennifer "Jenny" Flint (née Scarrity) was the human maid and wife of Madame Vastra. Operating from London in the late 19th century, the two performed a variety of investigations alongside their butler Strax, forming the so-called Paternoster Gang.

name: Alistair Gordon Lethbridge-Stewart
description: Sir Alistair Gordon Lethbridge-Stewart, often called the Brigadier, was an important figure within UNIT. Through his work, he became a trusted ally of the Doctor, as well as a personal friend.

name: Sarah Jane Smith
description: Sarah Jane Smith, also known as Sarah Jane Morley in one account, was a companion of the Third and Fourth Doctors.

name: K9
description: K9 was the designation given to a series of intelligent, dog-like robots who served as companions of Professor Marius, the Fourth Doctor, Leela, Romana, the Mistress, Sarah Jane Smith and others.

name: Jackie Tyler
description: Jacqueline Andrea Suzette Tyler, often called just Jackie, born 1 February 1967, was the mother of Rose Tyler. She lived with Rose in a council flat on the Powell Estate. Widowed following the death of her husband, Jackie was a single mother.

name: Astrid Peth
description: Astrid Peth was a native of the planet Sto who worked as a waitress aboard the Titanic. She was a potential companion to the Tenth Doctor.

name: Jackson Lake
description: Jackson Lake was a 19th century mathematics teacher who briefly believed himself to be an incarnation of the Doctor, but in reality, had his memories altered by a Cyberman infostamp. As the real Doctor told him, the Infostamp that backfired, and made him believe he was the Doctor, only gave him information about the Doctor; all the bravery and his invention of a different kind of TARDIS, were things he was capable of doing on his own.

name: Christina de Souza
description: Lady Christina de Souza was a friend of the Tenth and Eleventh Doctors, and had brief adventures with them both. A minor British aristocrat, she was also a thief, Burglar, and an adrenaline junkie who stole more for the thrill than for money.

name: Adelaide Brooke
description: Captain Adelaide Brooke, was briefly a companion of the Tenth Doctor. During the Daleks' attempt to destroy reality, she ended up being orphaned when both of her parents never returned home. She was raised by her grandmother afterwards and, as the years passed, eventually became a mother and grandmother herself. She was commander of Bowie Base One on Mars in the late 2050s.

name: Susan Foreman
description: Susan was the preferred name of the Doctor's granddaughter, who travelled with the First Doctor as his first companion.

name: Fugitive Doctor
description: The Fugitive Doctor was an incarnation of the Doctor who, against her will, worked for the Division on behalf of Gallifrey until she tried to desert her responsibilities, becoming a fugitive.

name: Strax
description: Commander Strax was a Sontaran commander who was forced to serve as a nurse to restore the honour of his clone batch. He fought and died at the Battle of Demons Run to repay the Doctor, to whom he owed a debt for saving his life. Strax was later resurrected by Vastra and Jenny Flint and lived in Victorian London with them, acting as their butler.

name: Staal
description: General Staal "the Undefeated" of the Tenth Sontaran Battle Fleet was a Sontaran general during the Sontaran invasion of Earth in 2009.

name: Dorium Maldovar
description: Dorium Maldovar was a 52nd century Crespallion black marketeer and owner of the Maldovarium.

name: Lorna Bucket
description: Lorna Bucket was an inhabitant of the Gamma Forests, a "Gamma Girl" who became a Cleric of the Church after her encounter with the Eleventh Doctor as a child. She was killed during the Battle of Demon's Run.

name: Henry Avery
description: Captain Henry Avery was a pirate and former naval officer. Also known as the Arch Pirate or King of Pirates, he sometimes used the alias Benjamin Bridgeman and was known to his crew as Long Ben. Avery enjoyed a short but prosperous career as a pirate from 1694 until he disappeared from records in 1696.

name: Madame Kovarian
description: Madame Kovarian was an associate of the religious movement the Silence, representing the Kovarian Chapter.

name: Elizabeth X
description: Elizabeth X of the United Kingdom (also known as Liz Ten) was the Queen Regnant of the United Kingdom of Great Britain and Northern Ireland when Earth was devastated by solar flares in the 29th century, but due to technological interference with her body clock, she lived (and reigned) for well over two centuries.

name: Winston Churchill
description: Winston Leonard Spencer-Churchill was the Prime Minister of the United Kingdom during World War II, specifically from 1940 to 1945, and again from 1951 to 1955 for a second term. He was a frequent ally of the Doctor, though, much like River Song, tended to meet with him out of sequential order.

name: Vincent van Gogh
description: Vincent Willem van Gogh was a famous Dutch painter of the late 19th century who painted much of his work in France. Van Gogh suffered from intense mental illness, including anxiety and depression. Although largely unknown at the time of his death, he went on to be regarded by Dr Henry Black as one of the greatest painters of all time.

name: Jo Grant
description: Josephine Jones, also known as Jo, was a companion of the Third Doctor.

name: Ace
description: Ace was a companion of the Seventh Doctor. Her real name was either Dorothy Gale or Dorothy Gale McShane.

name: Peri Brown
description: Perpugilliam Brown, also known as Peri, was a companion of the Fifth and Sixth Doctors, as well as a temporary companion to the Second Doctor during an encounter with Dastari.

name: Adric
description: Adric was a companion of the Fourth and Fifth Doctors.

name: Ian Chesterton
description: Sir Ian Francis Chesterton, Knight of Jaffa, was a companion of the First Doctor.

name: Vislor Turlough
description: Junior Ensign Commander Vislor Turlough was a companion of the Fifth Doctor.

name: Vicki Pallister
description: Vicki Pallister was a companion of the First Doctor.

name: Nyssa
description: Nyssa, also known as Nyssa of Traken, was a companion of the Fourth and Fifth Doctors.

name: Romana
description: Romanadvoratrelundar — known in short as Romana — was a Time Lord who was assigned the task to assist the Fourth Doctor in his quest for the Key to Time.
